subject: "Developer Testing"/"Programmer Testing"
msgSnippet: ... This bothers me, only because we ve been pushing the term Programmer Testing , and now, rather than collide with unit testing , it has to collide with
messageBody:
Thomas L Roche wrote:

> testdriven.com <webmaster@...> wrote on 08/09/2004 04:46:46 AM:
> > Kent Beck, the father of test-driven development joined Agitar
> > Software as Agitar Software Fellow. Agitar makes tools that automate
> > and support developer testing. The editors of testdriven.com wish
> > Kent great success in his new role.
>
> > "There is a strong movement towards increased accountability for
> > software developers and software development organizations.
> > Accountability is expected from every other profession in the world,
> > and now software developers are being held accountable too.
> > Developer Testing is a important step towards accountability. It
> > gives developers a way to demonstrate the quality of the software
> > they produce. Developing transparently, they become more productive
> > by wasting less time reworking errors", says Kent.
>
> Perhaps, now that the "developer testing" usage has been blessed (with
> proper casing, no less !-) the community can acknowledge that
> developers can automate testing "beyond the unit" (e.g. functional
> testing). (Perhaps, even that GUI developers _should_ use them :-)
> Just because they named it xUnit doesn't mean you can only unit test
> with it!
>
> > http://www.testdriven.com/modules/news/article.php?storyid=161
> > http://www.testdriven.com/modules/news/article.php?storyid=163

This bothers me, only because we've been pushing the term "Programmer
Testing", and now, rather than collide with "unit testing", it has to
collide with "Developer Testing". The good news is that we have survived
to this point, so perhaps it doesn't matter.

All that said, I'd rather the community move forward than stand still,
and this looks good in that regard.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
